sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The Dictionary application enables you to search words and terms on a dictionary source.

sect2.title: To Start Dictionary
sect2.para: You can start Dictionary in the following ways:
Once started, the Dictionary window is displayed:

sect2.title: Looking up a word
sect2.para: To look up a word, type it into the entry field and press Enter.
If some definition for the word is found, it will appear inside the main window area:

textobject.phrase: Shows a definition inside the Dictionary main window.

sect2.para: Otherwise, an error dialogue will appear, with a message explaining the nature of the error.

sect2.title: Save look up results
sect2.para: To save the results of a look up, choose FileSave a Copy. Enter a name for the file in the Save a Copy dialogue, then click Save.

sect2.title: Print look up results
sect2.para: To print the results of a look up, choose FilePrint.
Inside the Print dialog you can select the printer to use, the paper format, the number of copies.
To see a preview of what will be printed, click Preview.
To print, click Print.

sect2.title: Find Text

textobject.phrase: Shows the Dictionary Find pane inside the main window.

sect2.para: To find text inside the results of a look up, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose EditFind to display the Find pane.
Type the text you want to find inside the Search entry.
To find the next occurrence of the text, click Next. To find the previous occurrence of the text, click Previous.

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para: To change the Dictionary application preferences, choose EditPreferences.

sect2.title: Dictionary Sources

textobject.phrase: Shows the Source tab of the Preferences dialogue.

sect2.para: To change the dictionary source used to look up words, select the desired source from the list.

sect2.title: Adding a new source
sect2.para: To add a new dictionary source, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Edit the name of the new source inside the Description entry
Change the transport type of the new source using the Transport combo box
Edit the attributes of the new source

sect2.para: Different source transport types uses different attributes. This is the list of available attributes per transport type:

entry.para: Hostname: the hostname of the dictionary server
Port: the port of the dictionary server

sect2.title: Removing a source
sect2.para: To remove a dictionary source, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Select the source you wish to remove

warning.para: If you remove a dictionary source it will be permanently deleted from the list of available sources. Also, as some sources might be defined system-wide you may actually not be able to remove them unless you have the right ownership privileges.

sect2.title: Print Options

textobject.phrase: Shows the Print tab inside the Preferences dialogue.

sect2.para: If you want to change the font name and size used when printing, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Click on the Print Font button
Select the font and size you wish to use

sect1.title: The Dictionary Applet
sect1.para: The Dictionary application comes with a panel applet, the Dictionary Applet. You can add the Dictionary Applet applet to a panel and look up words in dictionaries.

sect2.title: To Start Dictionary Applet
sect2.para: To add Dictionary Applet to a panel, right-click on the panel, then choose Add to Panel. Select Dictionary Applet in the Add to the panel dialogue, then click OK.

sect2.title: Using the Dictionary Applet
sect2.para: To look up a word, type it into the entry field, and press Enter or right-click on the dictionary icon and then choose Look up.
If some definition for the word was found, a window will appear, with the text of the definitions:
Click Save to save the definitions to a text file. Click Print to print the definitions. Click Clear to clear the definitions.
You can make the window disappear by left-clicking on the dictionary icon or by pressing Esc.

sect2.title: Preferences
sect2.para: To configure the Dictionary Applet, right-click on the dictionary icon, then choose Preferences.
